quotes.quote: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone.
The person who is basically evil by nature will always be averse to virtuous deeds. He is always engaged in bad karma.
Karma moves in two directions. If we act virtuously, the seed we plant will result in happiness. If we act nonvirtuously, suffering results.
The jealous are troublesome to others, but torment to themselves.
Every sin carries its own punishment.
Let them fall into the snare which they have laid.
Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
Karma is not just about the troubles, but also about surmounting them.
Men are not punished for their sins, but by them.
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein.
Men may not get all they pay for in this world; but they must certainly pay for all they get.
Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
They who give have all things; they who withhold have nothing.
If you keep saying things are going to be bad, you have a chance of being a prophet.
One who previously made bad karma, but who reforms and creates good karma, brightens the world like the moon appearing from behind a cloud.
Never Try To Ruin Someone.. That's Bad Karma.. Let Them Ruin Themselves The Victory Is That Much Sweeter. You Reap What You Sow!
Life is just like a boomerang doing bad things to others and karma is turning back double to you.
Before you begin on the journey of revenge, dig two graves.
Punishment awaits all offenses.
He falls into the pit who leads another to it.
I would never disrespect any man, woman, chick or child out there. We re all the same. What goes around comes around, and karma kicks us all in the butt in the end of the day.
He who sows evil reaps remorse.
He prepares evil for himself who plots mischief for others.
He that slays shall be slain.
Every man's sin falls on his own head.
Be careful how you treat people. What you do to others has a funny way of coming back on you.
Harm set, harm get.
KARMA is nothing more than a REMINDER that we are ONE. Harming others we ultimately end up harming ourselves.
Remember! What goes around comes around three times harder than before. Karma is a bitch and one day it will come for you.
Let the punishment match the offense.
I'm a true believer in karma. You get what you give, whether it's bad or good.
Is Fate getting what you deserve, or deserving what you get?
Sooner or later in life, we will all take our own turn being in the position we once had someone else in.
My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground on which I stand.
How people treat you is their karma, how you react is yours.

Still others commit all sorts of evil deeds, claiming karma doesn't exist. They erroneously maintain that since everything is empty, committing evil isn't wrong. Such persons fall into a hell of endless darkness with no hope of release. Those who are wise hold no such conception.
Leave behind the passive dreaming of a rose-tinted future. The energy of happiness exists in living today with roots sunk firmly in reality's soil.
Life will give you whatever experience is most helpful for the evolution of your consciousness.
As long as karma exists, the world changes. There will always be karma to be taken care of.
I believe in Karma. If the good is sown, the good is collected. When positive things are made, that returns well.
If you're really a mean person you're going to come back as a fly and eat poop.
Like gravity, karma is so basic we often don't even notice it.
Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.
A man is born alone and dies alone and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone; and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
I never kill insects. If I see ants or spiders in the room, I pick them up and take them outside. Karma is everything.
Karma comes after everyone eventually.
The law is simple. Every experience is repeated or suffered till you experience it properly.
I must have killed a lot of cows in a past life for Karma to hate me this much.
Those who pray for your downfall are concentrating negative thoughts towards you, without taking cognisance of the slippery ground in which they are standing, which could lead to their downfall.
You cannot control the results, only your actions.
What goes around comes around. And sometimes you get what’s coming around.
People pay for what they do, and still more, for what they have allowed themselves to become. And they pay for it simply, by the lives they lead.
Don’t waste time on revenge. The people who hurt you will eventually face their own karma.
Karma bides it’s time. You will always have to watch out. Karma is unforgiving and always gets payback.
No need for revenge. Just sit back and wait. Those who hurt you will eventually screw up themselves and if you’re lucky, God will let you watch.
Sooner or later, everyone sits down to a banquet of consequences.
Stop blaming others for the pains and sufferings you have. They are because of you, your karma, and your own disposition.
Dear Karma, I really hate you right now, you made your point.
This is your karma. You do not understand now, but you will understand later. The source of pain is within your own larger expression of being.
I believe that the Laws of Karma do not apply to show business, where good things happen to bad people on a fairly regular basis.
